title: Govt announces plan to transform Chembe bird sanctuary in Kalulushi District into Zoo
description:
Government has announced plans to turn Chembe Bird Sanctuary in Kalulushi District into a Zoo to service Copperbelt Province residents and beyond. Minister of Tourism, Rodney Sikumba, announced the plan when he graced the Zambia International Trade Fair (ZITF) Tourism Stakeholders’ Cocktail organised by the Zambia Tourism Agency in Ndola this week. He said government will ensure that different wildlife species including small grazers and big cats like lions are stocked at Chembe to allow Copperbelt residents to start regular visiting and seeing the ambassador species at facility just like Lusaka residents do at Munda Wanga. “This will help actualise […]

The post Govt announces plan to transform Chembe bird sanctuary in Kalulushi District into Zoo first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Zambia standards agency warns of punitive measures on importers of used undergarments
description:
The Zambia Compulsory Standards Agency (ZCSA) has warned of punitive measures against all importers who are illegally importing unsafe products, especially used undergarments. ZCSA Head of Communications, Brian Hatyoka, said the agency had noted with concern the continued illegal importation of used undergarments in the country by some importers. Hatyoka said this in a statement made available to Zambia Monitor in Kitwe after the agency conducted a road show on its operations. “This is contrary to the provisions of the Compulsory standard for used textile products – Zambian Standard (ZS) 559: Inspection and Acceptance Criteria for Used Textile Products,” he […]

The post Zambia standards agency warns of punitive measures on importers of used undergarments first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Global mine giant, Kobold, confident of discovering more copper ore at Mingomba
description:
Mining consortium, Kobold Metals, says it is confident more copper ore would be discovered at Zambia’s Mingomba Mine. Kobold has 52 percent shares, EMR Capital has 28 percent stake, while ZCCM-Investment Holding (ZCCM-IH) holds 20 percent. Co-founder and global president, Josh Goldman, said Kobold’s Al technology would guide the exploration and development of the Mingomba deposit enabling the discovery of copper beyond nine million tonnes of copper ore already discovered. “We have confidence in the Zambian economy, that is why we are committing ourselves to huge investments to explore for copper and other minerals,” Goldman said in Kitwe on Monday. […]

The post Global mine giant, Kobold, confident of discovering more copper ore at Mingomba first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Kitwe youth behind mathematics solution says K2 million needed to execute project
description:
Gabriel Kasonde, a youth behind the invention of a mathematics solution application called Elicate says he may need about K2 million to roll out his creation. The Kitwe youth came up with the voice-driven application to solve any maths question or problem from grade one to 12. He urged, during the Trade Fair in Ndola on Sunday, that the Ministry of Education should adopt and roll out the application across all schools to solve the challenge of high failure rate in mathematics. “I came up with this app around 2019 and what propelled me were the difficulties I encountered during […]

The post Kitwe youth behind mathematics solution says K2 million needed to execute project first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Kitwe experiencing near standstill, as motorists reportedly embark on fruitless chase for petrol
description:
Shortage of petrol has entered day seven in Kitwe and the surrounding areas with motorists making fruitless chase for the commodity. A check at most fuel stations on Wednesday by Zambia Monitor indicated a serious shortage of petrol. “We are fatigued with this fuel issue, there was no petrol in town, yesterday (Tuesday ). I spent the whole day chasing for petrol without making any trip,” a frustrated min-bus driver, Abraham Bwembya, stated in an interview in Kitwe. In Lusaka some filling stations have reportedly runout of fuel. A spot check on Wednesday in Lusaka established that some filling stations […]

The post Kitwe experiencing near standstill, as motorists reportedly embark on fruitless chase for petrol first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Developing Story: Filling stations in Lusaka reportedly running out of fuel
description:
Some filling stations in Lusaka are reportedly running out of fuel, leading to speculations on whether the Oil Marketing Companies (OMCs) are withholding the commodity in anticipation of an increase in fuel pump prices. A spot check on Wednesday in Lusaka established that some filling stations have not had any stocks of both diesel and petrol from last week. Among the affected filling stations are Total Energies and Rubis filling stations, along Alick Nkhata road and Total and Puma filling stations, along Kabulonga road. The Energy Regulation Board (ERB) has attributed the observed pockets of fuel outages at selected filling […]

The post Developing Story: Filling stations in Lusaka reportedly running out of fuel first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Management orders shutdown of Nchanga Smelter to contain molten metal leak, lives saved
description:
Konkola Copper Mines has announced that the Nchanga Smelter, which is operated by its subsidiary, KCM SmelterCo Limited has been shut down to facilitate repair works following a molten metal leakage from one of the furnaces. KCM General Manager for Corporate Affairs, Shapi Shachinda, in a statement issued in Kitwe on Tuesday said there was no loss of life or injuries to employees during the incident. Shachinda said around 07:30 hours on Monday, June 26, 2023, furnace parameters as read by the operator from the distributed control system (DCS), showed signs of metal leak. “All employees were immediately evacuated to […]

The post Management orders shutdown of Nchanga Smelter to contain molten metal leak, lives saved first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Group seeks more empowerment for visually-impaired persons
description:
Kitwe District Association of Persons with Disabilities (KIDAPED) chairperson, Gilbert Mumba, has called for implementation of user-friendly application forms for visually impaired persons. Mumba observed that visually impaired persons were having it difficult to fill in forms when applying for empowerment funds under the Constituency Development Fund (CDF). “The empowerment application forms have not been user friendly to people are visually impaired people, in this case there is no inclusive,” he said in an interview in Kitwe on Friday. Mumba urged the able-bodied to incorporate the differently able when they are forming cooperatives. Read more : zambia-committed-to-poverty-reduction-initiatives-minister-mwamba-assures-un He said the […]

The post Group seeks more empowerment for visually-impaired persons first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Mubanga sees gold as alternative to Zambia’s debt challenge, predicts $1.4 billion monthly revenue
description:
A business consultant based on the Copperbelt says the answer to Zambia’s debt burden may lie in exploiting its huge gold discovery. Augustine Mubanga estimates that a well-structured gold mining subsector can stimulate to the tune of US$1.4 billion. Mubanga said the country cannot fail to get 20 tonnes of gold monthly, which can grant it in excess of US$ 1.4 billion using the prevailing world price of the precious mineral. “The government should structure a local benefits mining policy that can enable the country gain more from gold, we can generate US$1.4 billion, which would provide an alternative to […]

title: Police report says Kitwe man may have committed suicide over undesirable social media post
description:
Undesirable social media posts may have led a Kitwe man to set himself ablaze to avoid facing ‘shame’, police have disclosed. Copperbelt Police Chief, Peacewell Mweemba, could not disclose the manner of the posts in a statement on Sunday. A businessman identified as Jeston Mwanza, aged 32, reportedly went straight into his abode, shut the room and set self-ablaze upon seeing what was posted about him on social media. “Police in Kitwe has recorded a suspected suicide case on Saturday between 16:00 and 16:45 hours in Kamitondo township in which Jeston Mwanza, 32, is said to have told one of […]

The post Police report says Kitwe man may have committed suicide over undesirable social media post first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Kitwe-based firm fraudulently claims K458,000 VAT, to undergo trial for financial crimes
description:
A Kitwe-based taxpayer who fraudulently recovered K458,000 Value Added Tax (VAT) has been found with a case to answer on false returns and tax evasion by the Economic and Financial Crimes Court. The case came up for a ruling before the Economic and Financial Crimes Court sitting on circuit from Lusaka on June 8, 2023, said Zambia Revenue Authority Corporate Communications Manager, Oliver Nzala, in a statement on Sunday. Nzala said Focus on Equipment and Services Limited, a registered taxpayer with ZRA jointly and whilst acting together with Xing Tang as Director, Edward Mwamulima as an Accountant and Kennedy Chintukwane […]

title: Chamber for small businesses wants industrial yards to evolve into business incubation centres
description:
Zambia Chamber of Small and Medium Business Association (ZACSMBA) says industrial yards being established by the government across the country should be used as business incubation centres. Misheck M’hango, the board Chairperson for ZACSMBA, said industrial yards were catalysts for industrialisation and job creation if well utilised. M’hango said in an interview in Kalulushi on Thursday that business incubation for Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) were critical for economic development. “Our view is that, let us use the industrial yards as business incubation centres where SMEs gain knowledge on how to drive the industry after which they are weaned off,” […]

The post Chamber for small businesses wants industrial yards to evolve into business incubation centres first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Advocacy group urges systematic approach to ban on sale of alcohol in residential areas
description:
Change Mindset Zambia Executive Director, Geoffrey Musonda, says there is need for systematic approach as the government bans the selling of alcohol in residential areas. Musonda said in an interview on Monday in Kitwe that there was need to consider economic factors before banning the selling of alcoholic beverages in residential areas. “The economy is not good at the moment, in as much as the government wants sanity in the way people do business, there is need to think of how they will survive,” he said. Grary Nkombo, the Local Government and Rural Development Minister, is said to have directed […]

The post Advocacy group urges systematic approach to ban on sale of alcohol in residential areas first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Detach politics from Constituency Development Fund, Catholic priest enjoins govt
description:
The Catholic Church in the country has noted the need to detach politics from issues such as the Constituency Development Fund (CDF) that are development centered. Addressing congregants during a Church Service in Ndola on Sunday and monitored by Zambia Monitor, Father Ferena Lambe, Minister Provincial of the Franciscan Friars in Zambia and Malawi said this should be done in the interest of working together to achieve change. Father Lambe hailed the impact of the Constituency Development Fund, in communities across the country, which he has described as a game changer and life changing to most Zambians. He said this […]

The post Detach politics from Constituency Development Fund, Catholic priest enjoins govt first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Govt bans sale of alcoholic beverages in markets, bus stations
description:
Government has with immediate effect banned the sale of alcohol in markets and bus stations. In addition, the authority has directed the cancellation of all liquor home shops licenses. This is according to circular issued in Lusaka on Thursday by Ministry of Local Government and Rural Development Permanent Secretary in-charge of Technical Services, Nicholas Phiri. Phirl directed local authorities in the country to enforce laws regulating the manufacturing, distribution and consumption of alcohol. He stated in circular to the local authorities that the directive is in view of the devastating effects of alcohol on the society largely facilitated by its […]

The post Govt bans sale of alcoholic beverages in markets, bus stations first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Standards bureau calls for urgent creation of regional laboratory for mineral testing on the Copperbelt
description:
Zambia Bureau of Standards (ZABS) regional laboratory should urgently be set up on the Copperbelt for testing minerals. This is according to the ZABS Board Chairperson, Mbobe Nyondo, at the Copperbelt Agricultural Mining Industrial Networking Enterprise (CAMINEX) in Kitwe on Wednesday. Nyondo observed the need to urgently establish a ZABS regional laboratory on the Copperbelt to enable the testing of products at source especially for minerals. “The proximity to the source would provide ease of access by the mines and other stakeholders who may need to access ZABS testing services,” he said. Nyondo said this when Mines and Mineral Development […]

The post Standards bureau calls for urgent creation of regional laboratory for mineral testing on the Copperbelt first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Machine chops Kitwe man into pieces in sawmill accident
description:
A man in his early 30s has reportedly died after he fell on a sawmill machine, which chopped him into pieces. Police say the incident happened on Friday around 17:00 hours at a named sawmilling workshop in Kitwe. Copperbelt Police Chief, Peacewell Mweemba, in a statement on Saturday stated that Anthony Mbelebesha 32 slipped and fell on the sawmill machine which reportedly cut him into two pieces. Read more : Six feared dead in Chingola-Solwezi car crash “The deceased reported for work in the morning and in the afternoon he took a break to have his lunch and resumed work […]

title: Group laments independence without economic freedom, faults ‘auction’ of critical industries
description:
Geoffrey Musonda, Change Mindset Zambia Executive Director, says for Africa and Zambia, in particular, to attain meaningful freedom and independence, local mineral resource ownership should be a must. Musonda in an interview in Kitwe on Saturday said while the continent is endowed with huge mineral resources, its citizens continue to wallow in poverty. “There is need for mindset change, we have just celebrated the Africa Freedom Day, freedom with economic power has been elusive, we need to own the means of production,” he said. Read more : Pan-Africanist, Musonda, faults Africa Freedom Day without economic freedom Musonda said the ‘grave’ […]

The post Group laments independence without economic freedom, faults ‘auction’ of critical industries first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: Again, UPND officials heckle Kitwe Mayor, ask her to stop politicking, focus on civic duties
description:
Kitwe’s Wusakile Constituency United for National Development (UPND) official says Kitwe Mayor, Mpansa Mwaya,should concentrate on civic duties rather than politicking. Since her posting in a Patriotic Front (PF) media WhatsApp group, allegedly calling for the resignation of President Hakainde Hichilema, the ruling party has continued taking on the mayor. The latest, after youths from the Copperblet vowed never to allow the Mayor attend any presidential function, the UPND in Wusakile has now cautioned the civic leader to concentrate her energies on Constituency Development Fund (CDF). This is according to a statement issued in Lusaka on Tuesday. UPND Wusakile Patrict […]

title: UPND reacts to remarks by  catholic priest, Salangeta, who called out President Hichilema, other politicians
description:
The ruling United Party for National Development (UPND) says it has has forgiven the Catholic priest, Father Anthony Salangeta, for his recent attacks on President Hakainde Hichilema. Lusaka’s Chawama Catholic Church Parish Priest, Father Salangeta, said sometimes politicians can be deceitful and detached from reality because people on the ground are interested in issues that directly affect them as opposed to rhetoric by politicians. In his homily during Mass attended by former president Edgar Lungu, Father Salangeta said people on the ground are interested in having food in their homes and not the graphs which were presented by President Hichilema […]

title: ‘Come to equity with clean hands,’ Mundubile knocks UPND govt for attempts to gag citizens
description:
Leader of the opposition in parliament, Brian Mundubile, says the United Party for National Development (UPND) administration must reflect on the continued harassment of citizens whenever they exercise their right to speak because it is guaranteed in the Constitution of Zambia. Mundubile in a statement issued in Lusaka on Tuesday said, it is shocking that the UPND is demanding respect for the Presidency when they never respected former president Edgar Lungu. He said Kitwe Mayor Mpasa Mwaya’s alleged comment on social media in a manner that did not refer to President Hakainde Hichilema did not call for harassment from Copperbelt […]

title: 58 kids among 207 persons picked from Kitwe streets for various offences
description:
Police Deputy Public Relations Officer, Danny Mwale, says a joint team of law enforcement agencies has rounded up 207 people during a joint operation in Kitwe. Mwale said in a statement on Sunday that of the 207, 58 are street kids. The suspected street kids have reportedly been taken to an orphanage. The exercise was conducted between May 19 at 23:00 and May 20 around 03:00 hours. Areas that were combed by law enforcement officers in the night include the town centre, Chisokone market and Kitwe main bus station. Read more : NGOs concerned about teenage drug abuse A team […]

title: PF threatens ‘rebellion’ if ruling UPND continues disrespecting office holders in leading opposition party
description:
The Patriotic Front (PF) has warned that it would stop recognising President Hakainde Hichilema as head of State should the ruling party continue disrespecting its elected leaders such as Mayors, Council Chairpersons and Councilors. Given Lubinda, the PF acting Vice President, said the UPND was free to ban all the Mayors, Council Chairpersons and Councillors from welcoming President Hichilema or indeed attending any of the events at which the Head of State was going to be the guest because the civic leaders were not obliged as it was not one of their civic duties. Lubinda said soon after the PF […]

title: Ex-lawmaker, Kapalasa, not entitled to claim of K400,00, Kitwe resident tells court
description:
A Kitwe resident has submitted to the Lusaka High Court, that former Katuba Member of Parliament, Bampi Kapalasa was not entitled to his claim of K400,000, as there was no illegality in obtaining the money. In this matter, Kapalasa sued David Mensah, resident of plot no.43, Limulunga Crescent, Riverside, Kitwe, the Attorney General and Speaker of the National Assembly, Nelly Mutti, that they pay back the K400,000.00, being his end of year gratuity earnings. title: Drug enforcement agency arrests 4 persons for being in possession of counterfeit currencies
description:
The Drug Enforcement Commission (DEC) on the Copperbelt Province has arrested four people for being in possession of counterfeit notes contrary to the laws of Zambia. DEC Public Relations Officer, Hussein Khan, said the Commission has jointly arrested and charged Joseph Mpundu, aged 63 of Mufulira, John Lumbwe, aged 30 of Kasama, Elisha Londwe, aged 32 of Ndola and Mathews Sandwe, aged 45 of Chiengi. Khan said this in a statement issued to Zambia Monitor on Saturday in Lusaka. title: Kitwe UPND youths threaten to deny Mayor Mpasa Mwaya access to presidential functions
description:
United Party for National Development (UPND) youths have urged opposition politicians not to undermine government as they politick. At the media briefing on Friday in Kitwe, ruling youths on the Copperbelt threatened to start blocking Kitwe Mayor Mpasa Mwaya from state functions accusing her of undermining government. Mwaya is reported to have demanded for the immediate resignation of President Hakainde Hichilema for alleged failure to comport himself during the media conference held at state house in Lusaka on Thursday. title: Enforcement agencies seize illegal spirits worth K150,000, confiscate bales of used underwear
description:
A joint team of officers from enforcement agencies have seized illegally produced potable spirits worth over K150,000, while closing down three facilities in Lusaka for unlawful manufacturing of the products. This was after the Zambia Compulsory Standards Agency (ZCSA) conducted joint operations with the Lusaka City Council (LCC), Zambia Metrology Agency (ZMA) and the police on the illegal production of beverages in the first quarter of 2023. This is according  to the ZCSA Head Communication Brian Hatyoka in a statement in Lusaka on Monday. title: Health Minister Masebo, begs doctors for forgiveness, insists corruption rife in hospitals
description:
Health Minister, Sylvia Masebo, has succumbed to pressure by the health bodies and apologized for calling them ‘thieves’. Masebo had in the past two days received condemnation for accusing medical personnel of championing pilferage of medical supplies in the country. She said, during a gathering of Resident Doctors Association (RDA) at the Annual General Assembly (AGM) and conference in Kitwe on Saturday, that since her remarks had been blown out of proportion, she had no choice but to say ‘sorry’. “Let me make the matter straight, media reports going around that I referred to all health personnel as thieves are […]

title: NAPSA FC seek to redeem selves, offer free entry for fans for week 33 fixture
description:
NAPSA Stars coach, Perry Mutapa, says the team, also known as Pensioners, are determined to redeem themselves by beating Forest Rangers in Friday’s Week-33 fixture at Heroes Stadium. The determination comes after last weekend’s painful 1-0 defeat to Nkana in Kitwe. Mutapa confirmed that the final home fixture of the season was free for all their fans who deserved to be given a win. description:
Public Policy Expert, James Musonda, says the booting out of ZCCM-Investments Holdings (ZCCM-IH) on the London Stock Exchange (LSE) is long held view that the current government is a mining disaster. Musonda, a mining researcher said the suspension of ZCCM-IH from LSE coinciding with the resignation of Board Chairperson, Dolika Banda, shows the United Party for National Development (UPND)’s mining policy failure. “This illustrates what we have been talking about the mining approach adopted by the UPND which has been a disaster,” he said in a statement in Kitwe on Tuesday. description:
Copperbelt Police Chief, Peacewell Mweemba, says a 60-year-old Tanzanian truck driver has reportedly died while in convoy on the way to the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). Mweemba said in a statement on Sunday that Ally Chomba, aged 60, died from sudden and unnatural death according to preliminary investigations. “We recorded a sudden and unnatural death of the truck driver on Sunday around 07:00 hours along the Kitwe-Chingola road near Yama’s lodge in Chambishi,” he said. title: Nchanga Rangers parts ways with head coach, first assistant
description:
Nchanga Rangers Football Club Executive Committee has parted ways with Head Coach, Aggrey Chiyangi, and first assistant, Rotson Kilambe, through mutual consent. Second Assistant, Ronald Mukosha, will assume the role of interim Head Coach until further notice. This is according to a Media statement issued in Kitwe on Sunday. description:
The Drug Enforcement Commission (DEC) has arrested two Zambian nationals for drug trafficking. Public Relations Officer, Hussein Khan, said the Commission in Lusaka has formally jointly charged and arrested Masauso Mbao, a male aged 43 of Kitwe and Sunday Simuntala, a male aged 23 also of Kitwe for Trafficking in Narcotic Drugs. title: Over 16,000 girls drop out of school every year, only 27 percent attain grade 12
description:
More than sixteen thousand girls drop out of school every year in Zambia due to early marriages and teenage pregnancies, says the Forum for African Women Educationalist Zambia (FAWEZA). FAWEZA Chief Executive Director, Costern Kanchele, has noted the need to increase advocacy by all stakeholders in changing the mindset of youths especially the girl child that are deprived the right to school as a result of early marriages and teenage pregnancies. title: Attorney General rules K400,000 gratuity of ex-Katuba lawmaker in court possession has legal backing
description:
Former Katuba Member of Parliament, Bampi Kapalasa’s end of year gratuity earnings were transferred to the Kitwe High Court in compliance with an order of the court, the Attorney General Mulilo Kabesha has submitted. In the matter before the Lusaka High Court, Kapalasa sued David Mensaha resident of plot no.43, Limulunga Crescent, Riverside, Kitwe, the Attorney General and Speaker of the National Assembly, Nelly Mutti, that they pay back the K400,000.00. title: Four die in Kitwe-Chingola road accident
description:
Four people are reportedly dead after being involved in a fatal road accident along Kitwe-Chingola Road. The four, according to police, were passengers in vehicle that was hit by another moving truck from the opposite direction. Of the four passengers reported dead, two have been identified as Arnold Katwishi, 36, and Kapito Sailasi, 31, both of Masansa area in Mkushi. The other two are yet to be identified. title: Copperbelt Minister, Matambo, frowns at casualization of labour
description:
Elisha Matambo, the Copperbelt Minister, says employers should stop the trend of engaging casual labour at the expense of providing decent jobs. Matambo said in Kitwe on Monday while officiating at the Kitwe International Labour Day celebrations that labour laws must be adhered to to avoid heavy sanctions. “Government will not tolerate employers who are abrogating the labour laws with impunity,” he said. Others in attendance included Zambia Congress of Trade Unions (ZCTU) vice president, Joseph Chewe, Kitwe Mayor and chairperson for the labour day organising committee, Fewdays Bwalya. title: Over 700 women benefit from $450,000 empowerment fund
description:
More than 700 women in Zambia have benefited from the Academy for Women Entrepreneurs (AWE) programme with about US$450,000 seed grant given to them. This is under the initiative designed to empower women globally to assist them fulfil their economic potential since 2019. AWE is an initiative of the Women’s Global Development and Prosperity and targets to reach millions of women by 2025 by promoting an enabling environment that reduces barriers and facilitates women’s participation in the economy. The programme is being implemented since inception by the Women Entrepreneurs Access Center (WEAC) with support from the United States embassy. Small […]

title: Former freedom fighters want more govt attention, say Lungu has right to seek power if qualified
description:
The Former Freedom Fighters’ Association of Zambia says government should give them more attention. The association has also said that it was shameful that the plight of those who “died” during the struggle for independence keeps on worsening without any attention by government. Copperbelt Chapter Chairperson, John Waluka, also said former President, Edgar Lungu, has every right to re-contest the elections and that they have no reservations about him vying for the presidency. “In Zambia we have democratic principles which we have held for many years, so debate going on that the former President wants to re-contest, we have no […]

description:
Mary Chirwa has said she is still the Director General of the Drug Enforcement Commission (DEC) contrary to reports that President Hichilema has removed her from the Commission and appointed her High Commissioner designate to Mozambique. Chirwa said she has no idea that President Hichilema has removed her from DEC as she had not received any official communication apart from the gossip buzz on social media. title: Kitwe local authority raids  houses in Chimwemwe, Buyantanshi ward for illegal sale of alcohol
description:

According to KCC Public Relations Officer, Mwaka Nakweti, this is in line with the Council’s continued operations to curtail the brewing and sale of illicit alcohol, the sale of alcohol without permits, and the sale of alcohol in non-designated areas. description:
Green Party president, Peter Sinkamba has predicted that food insecurity may linger for ‘two to three years’ for lack of proper planning and low crop production for the 2022/2023 farming season. According to Sinkamba in a statement issued on Saturday in Kitwe, government, through the Food Reserve Agency (FRA) will buy 250,000 metric tonnes of maize, 1,000 metric tonnes of Paddy Rice and 50,000 metric tonnes of Soya Beans. He said in effect, the total storage capacity for the grains to be procured will only be 300,000 metric tonnes of the 1.1 million metric tonnes that is serviceable. “Currently Zambia […]

title: Pension scheme law good, will ensure control, expose defaulting employers —Lampi
description:
Former University of Zambia Lecturers and Researchers Union (UNZALARU) president, Evans Lampi, says the National Pension Scheme Amendment Bill 2023, which was signed into law will expose the extent of non-compliance among employers. President Hakainde Hichilema on Friday in Lusaka signed into law the National Pension Scheme Amendment Bill 2023 which allows National Authority Pension Scheme Authority (NAPSA) beneficiaries to partially withdrawal their benefits. Lampi said in addition, the new law will also expose the extent and efficiency of NAPSA in enforcing penalties on defaulters. title: Signing of pension access bill into law, a momentous achievement —Kitwe UPND
description:
Ruling United Party for National Development (UPND) says President Hakainde Hichilama’s assent to the National Pension Scheme Authority (NAPSA) partial pension access bill into law is a momentous political achievement. Reacting to the new development in a statement on Tuesday, UPND Kitwe District Information and Publicity Secretary, Jim Kaunda, said critics of President Hichilema have been silenced by the move. “We are extremely excited to see the President assent to the bill, this is yet another campaign promise fulfilled. title: Govt launches healthcare body to drive public-private sector engagements
description:
Government has launched the Healthcare Federation of Zambia (HFZ), a platform for public-private sector dialogue and coordination. Health Minister, Sylvia Masebo, said this was missing, thereby leading to inefficiency in service delivery in the country. She said although the private sector has continued to play a central and fundamental role in delivering health products and services in Zambia and attaining Universal Health Coverage by 2030, it is not well coordinated within the private space. title: Govt charges Serenje Council to check illegal manganese mining, pollution of Luombwa River
description:
Government has urged the Serenje District Council to closely monitor what is happening at the Serenje dump site in Central Province where some youths are conducting illegal Manganese mining activities. Minister of Green Economy and Environment, Collins Nzovu, has noted that the Serenje Manganese dump site is situated near the Luombwa River which is used by the community in Kabundi for various purposes and this may cause health hazards for the people that consume water from the said river. title: Special Report: Food security threatened, as illegal cassava exports thrive in border areas
description:
A cassava market assessment by the Zambia Monitor on the Copperbelt reveals a serious shortage of cassava which residents turn to when mealie meal products are in short supply. Some traders from the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), Burundi and Kenya are working with farmers in Luapula, the major producer of cassava, and ‘mopping up everything’ they are producing, thereby completely cutting supply to the Copperbelt. A check in Kitwe, Mufulira, Chingola and Chililabombwe found empty storage facilities that used to stock the commodity for resale. The short supply has also been attributed to an outbreak of a strange virus […]

description:
Police have confirmed the arrest of a 32-year-old man of Solwezi for defiling a 15-year-old juvenile. description:
ZCCM-IH Board Chairperson, Dolika Banda, has called for gender equity in business and employment in mining value chain. description:

He was received during a media briefing in Kitwe on Sunday by UPND national youth chairperson Gilbert Liswaniso and Copperbelt youth chairperson Warren Hinyama , among others. title: Opposition CDP leader, Pule, wants to be Zambia’s president in 2026. See his reasons

title: Police declare 32-year-old man wanted for beating elder brother to death
description:
Police on the Copperbelt are pursuing a 32-year-old man for allegedly beating to death his elder brother aged 46 with axe handle after misunderstanding. Copperbelt Police Chief Peacewell Mweemba said a 32-year-old man of Kitwe’s Bulangililo township is currently on the run. title: Depot Manager, two others nabbed over theft of fertilizer valued at K1.3 million
description:
Police in Lusaka on Tuesday arrested three (3) people including a Depot Warehouse Manager in connection with the theft of fertilizer valued at over K1.3 million at Sea Land Commodity Company Limited. description:

Japan will provide an additional grant of US$17 million to the US$25 million which was earlier given to Zambia. title: Socialist Party president, M’membe, condemns alleged UPND youth day violence
description:
Socialist Party president, Fred M’membe, says violence should never be a political strategy, tactic in a multiparty political dispensation. M’membe said the violence allegedly visited by members of the United National Independence Party (UPND) against the Patriotic Front (PF) youths on Youth Day in Kitwe on Sunday is barbarism that should not be tolerated by us all. Read more: Violence erupts at youth day celebrations in Ndola, as PF alleges attack by UPND cadres Some UPND cadres in Kitwe reportedly attacked the PF youths during the youth day celebrations on Sunday leaving several injured and M’membe said that this is […]

title: President Hichilema, at National Youth Day event, challenges youths to be innovators
description:
President Hakainde Hichilema on Sunday officiated at this year’s Youth Celebrations in the mining town of Kitwe on the Copperbelt. President Hakainde said youths were the future of the country and should take advantage of various empowerment programmes to change the economic trajectory. He said Zambia was not supposed to be at the bottom and he emphasize on working hard. “Zambia is not Lusaka, Zambia is consolidation of the provinces,that is why we are here ,” President Hichilema said. Read more: govt-prioritizing-youth-employment-skills-acquisition-healthcare-for-rapid-economic-development-phiri He said youths should be at the centre of the economy as the reason the government decided to […]

title: Police detain three, including Lebanese, in Kitwe  for theft of brown sugar
description:
Copperbelt Police Chief Peacewell Mweemba says three people have been detained in connection with the theft of 700 by 50 kilogramme bags of brown  sugar valued at K560,000 in Kitwe. Also  arrested is Hamdy Isarak 59 of Lebanese origin of unknown house number in Kitwe’s Riverside area for receiving stolen items. “Three people have been detained in Kitwe for alleged  theft of bags of brown sugar valued at K560,000 that were in transit to Mokambo border en-route to the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) from Ndola,” Mweemba said. Read more : Lumezi District Commissioner, Phiri, arrested, may be prosecuted for missing […]

title: Thief arrested for attempting to sell television he stole to the owner
description:
A Kitwe man has been arrested for attempting to sell a Television (TV) set to the person he stole it from. Sam Mwale was among four suspected criminals who stole a TV set from a Kitwe family. However, in a surprise turn of events, Mwale unknowingly went to sell the TV to the person he stole it from. This is according to Copperbelt police commanding officer Peacewell Mweemba in a statement issued on Friday. Mwale, 26 was nabbed and taken to police by Ngosa Chakalashi with the help of members of the public when he and his friends went to […]

title: Kitwe man dies in mine accident, coroner set to visit scene
description:
A man in his late 20s has died in a mine accident in Kitwe after a train wagon full of copper ore fell and squeezed him against the wall. Copperbelt Police Chief Peacewell Mweemba said  in a statement on Tuesday that  the incident  happened on Monday at around 11:20 hours at South Ore Body (SOB)  Nkana mine plant in Wusakile township. Mweemba said one of the directors of the Company, Harold Maluku, aged 51 reported that John Mwela, a general worker for BEEM Mine Suppliers died in a mine accident at level 3,360 meters. Read more:Three dead in Chongwe mine accident, […]

title: Kasempa youth reportedly commits suicide by hanging self to tree
description:
The police in Kasempa has recorded a suicide case involving a 22-year-old boy who allegedly hung himself to a tree. According to the North –Western Police Chief, Dennis Moola, the boy, Felix Kasanda, decided to take his life after he was condemned for wanting to punch his father who tried to stop a fight between him and his young sister. He was alleged to have turned against his father, Dason Kasanda, 51, by throwing a punch but missed after he tried to beat his sister who refused to carry a container of water from the borehole. On Saturday, Dason reported […]

title: Revenue authority tells how Changesheng Mining Equipment Company allegedly evaded tax
description:
The Zambia Revenue Authority (ZRA) has warned tax evaders of continued prosecution, a vice which has increased recently. ZRA has said that through intensified tax audits, it has recently observed an increase in tax evasion cases by taxpayers. Authority Corporate Communications Manager Oliver Nzala, has therefore sent a stern warning of continued prosecution of all those involved in tax evasion and smuggling activities. Nzala said the latest prosecuted case of tax evasion involved Changesheng Mining Equipment Company Limited and its Director Wang Qi, aged 33, who appeared before the Economic and Financial Crimes Court in Kitwe and was found with […]

title: How Kalulushi community police officer allegedly raped 20-year-old girl —Police chief
description:
Fredrick Kapasa 28, a Community Crime Prevention Officer (CCPU) of Kalulushi,has been arrested and detained for a charge of rape. Copperbelt Police Chief Peacewell Mweemba said Kapasa was arrested for allegedly raping a 20-year-old student whom he detained after coming from a birthday party. The incident happened on Sunday around 02:00 hours at Chibuluma Police post on the Copperbelt . He said the victim of Kitwe’s Bulangililo township studying general education at Katembula College reported that she was raped by Kapasa . Brief facts were that the victim in company of four others was coming from a birthday party around […]

title: Kitwe firms found guilty, to pay over K200 million for false returns, tax evasion
description:
Economic and Financial Crimes Court in Kitwe has convicted and fined Pingan Auto Services Limited K89 million. This is after finding the company guilty on 22 counts of false returns and statements and evasion of tax contrary to Section 43 and 44 of the Value Added Tax Act, Chapter 331 of the Laws of Zambia. In the same court, Santorini Investments Limited was fined K124 million in another case for fraudulently claiming Input Value Added Tax (VAT) from various Copperbelt based companies. This according to a statement issued in Kitwe on Friday by Zambia Revenue Authority( ZRA) Corporate Communications Manager […]

title: PF founding member, Chilufya, hits back at Sampa, describes him as divisive
description:
Patriotic  Front (PF) Kitwe District Chairperson, Evaristo Chilufya, has described as ‘divisive’ and  cheap policking Matero Member of Parliament Miles Sampa’s claims that the former ruling party has been hijacked by Movement for Multiparty Democracy (MMD). Sampa, who is PF aspiring candidate had alleged that some former MMD officials  hijacked the former ruling party during former President Edgar Lungu’s reign who he accused of hell-bent on hounding out founder members. Chilufya said it was cheap politics for Mr Sampa being a senior member of the party to exhibit such acrimonious sentiments. “This time we should have been preoccupied with reuniting […]

title: ZAFFICO timber price hike sparks protest, market leaders call for calm
description:
Sawmillers Association for Zambian Pine and Hardwood (SAZPH) says its members are not part of the protests carried by timber dealers against price hike of soft wood. Zambia Forest and Forestry Industries Corporation (ZAFFICO) announced an increase in the price of soft wood, which led to the demonstrations against the company’s decision. SAZPH Publicity Secretary Jonathan Mwape said in an interview on Wednesday in Kitwe that his Association believed in dialogue rather than taking it to the streets. “Accusing ZAFFICO of corruption and accusing them of favouring those who belong to the United Party for National Development (UPND) to us […]

title: Santorin, Junsheng to pay Zambian govt over K22 million for evading tax
description:
Over K22 million will be recovered by the Zambia Revenue Authority (ZRA) from tax evasion. This follows the conviction of two Copperbelt based companies by the Economic and Financial Crimes Court for tax evasion, contrary to the Value Added Tax Act. This is according to the ZRA Corporate Communications Manager, Oliver Nzala in a statement issued on Wednesday in Lusaka. Nzala said Santorin Investments Limited Company and its Director Victor Mwansa aged 33, and Junsheng Company Limited appeared before the Economic and Financial Crimes Court in Kitwe for judgment on February 22, 2023. The accused persons representing Santorin Investments Limited […]

title: Mwinilunga  boy, 5, drowns in flood waters
description:
A boy in Mwinilunga, North-Western Province aged five has  drowned in the flood waters. The incident happened while the boy was swimming with friends, North-Western Police Chief Dennis Moola said. In a statement issued on Tuesday in Kitwe, Moola said the incident happened on Tuesday around 16:00 hours in Kashinakazhi area. He said Den Masumba 65 reported that his grandson Given Samuneti drowned in the flood waters while swimming with friends. title: Two women escape death in Copperbelt Province, as stray bullet leaves them injured
description:
Two women who sell foodstuff at a makeshift  restaurant in Chambishi, Copperbelt Province have sustained injuries after a stray bullet hit them. Police  reported that two  women in Chambishi were hit by a  bullet while selling food in their makeshift restaurant. This was  after a truck driver fired gunshots at a group of unknown people who jumped onto his truck. Copperbelt Police Chief  Peacewell Mwemba said Trust Sakala 56 of Lusaka  fired gunshots  at the group . Mweemba  said Sakala had been arrested for unlawful assault. title: Police recover two stolen vehicles, as suspected robbers abandon vehicles
description:
Police in Kitwe recovered two motor vehicles on Monday that were allegedly stolen in Kitwe by unknown people at separate incidents. Copperbelt police chief Peacewell Mweemba in a statement said police in Kitwe had in two separate incidents recovered two motor vehicles, a Toyota Allion and a Toyota Corolla. Mweemba said they where stolen on Monday in Ndeke residential area and Robert township respectively but were later dumped in Kamitondo and Luangwa townships. title: Body found floating in Mansa river in a suspected suicide case
description:
Police in Mansa, Luapula province have disclosed that Francis Kapili’s body was found floating in  Mansa river. The  30-year-old man of Mansa  who went missing a few days after the death of his girlfriend has been found dead in the Mansa river. Luapula Police Chief Gloria Mulele said  in a statement on Sunday that Kapili’s body was found floating on the river after he went missing. Mulele said Mr Kapili went missing last Thursday around 07:00 hours a day after he received a call from the late girlfriend’s father commanding him to go to his place without fail. Read more :Kitwe man jumps into […]

title: Kitwe man jumps into river Kafue in suicide bid
description:
A man aged between 20 and 30 in Kitwe’s Bulangililo township has commited suicide by throwing himself into the crocodile infested river Kafue. Copperbelt police chief Peacewell Mweemba confirmed on Friday in a statement that unknown man aged between 20 and 30 committed suicide by throwing himself into the Kafue river. Police said George Siame a security officer from the Kitwe City Council (KCC) reported that a man had commited suicde by throwing himself into the Kafue river. title: Kitwe business expo returns after three-year lull
description:
After three-year ‘no show’ Copperbelt Agriculture, Mining, Industrial and Networking Expo (CAMINEX) will be staged at the Kitwe showgrounds. Copperbelt Mining, Agriculture and Commercial Show Society (CACSS) board chairperson London Mwafulilwa said in a statement on Thursday that dates for this year’s CAMINEX had been set. “We are pleased to announce that the Expo for the year 2023 will be held from May 30 to June 1, 2023 at the show grounds in Kitwe after a three-year absence due to the outbreak of Covid-19,” Mwafulilwa said. He said the global Covid -19 pandemic that came with many challenges on movement […]

title: Police detain 19-year-old boy for defilement
description:
A boy, aged about 19 years, of Kitwe’s Mindolo township has been arrested for allegedly defiling a 15-year-old girl who is now six months pregnant. Police said Kelvin Chushi allegedly defiled a 15-year-old in September last year while she was in her sixth grade. Copperbelt police chief Peacewell Mweemba in a statement on Wednesday said Chushi, a street vendor, has been arrested on the charge of defilement. Read more:police-nab-48-year-old-man-for-alleged-defilement-of-minor Mweemba said a sister to the juvenile reported that her younger sister was defiled by the suspect who is believed to be her boyfriend. The victim was taken to the hospital […]

title: National power supply receives 34 megawatts boost, as CEC launches solar project
description:
Copperbelt Energy Corporation (CEC) has launched its extended 34 megawatts solar project at a cost of US$22 million. President Hakainde Hichilema who officiated at the launch in Kitwe on Wednesday said the solar project would enhance the country’s power generation capacity. President Hichilema said the country looks at doubling the current 3,500 MW in the next five years and become a net exporter of power in the region. He said going forward, the private sector would be key in achieving the target milestones, adding that the private sector should partner with ZESCO to improve power transmission. He expressed disappointment that […]

title: Forest Rangers get approval to use Dola Hill for matches
description:
Zambia league side , Forest Rangers will start using Dola Hill for home games after a facelift. Following confederation from the Football Association of Zambia (FAZ), Forest Rangers had given Dola Hill ground in Ndola provisional clearance as an MTN Super League venue. This means that Forest Rangers will use Dola Hill for its home games beginning this weekend when they entertain Chambishi FC in a Week 23 fixture on Saturday 11 February, 2023. Read more: Kitwe side, Power Dynamos signs Muwowo to beef up team FAZ media statement on Friday said the Dola Hill stadium had been out of […]

title: Two crocodiles killed in Kitwe after reports of death of woman in river
description:
Zambia Wildlife Authority (ZAWA) has killed two crocodiles in Kitwe believed to have been attacking residents around river Kafue . Copperbelt police chief Peacewell Mweemba said it was believed that after killing a woman, it also allegedly killed a dog at the same spot on Monday. Following the attack authorities swung into action and shot two reptiles . On Thursday, police said one reptile returned to the same spot and ZAWA officers from Kalulushi camped at the area and around 20.00 hours they managed to gun it down but that it fell into the river and was later retrieved. Read […]

title: 19-year-old boy survives suicide attempt after jumping into River Kafue
description:
A 19-year-old boy in Kitwe has attempted suicide by throwing himself into the crocodile infested Kafue river in Kitwe. This is as he claimed that he was experiencing hardships due to poverty in his family. Copperbelt police chief Peacewell Mweemba confirmed the development on Thursday. This happened around 15:00 hours at council bridge in Bulangillo township. He said a council police officer only known as Chisala reported that Daniel Mulenga of Ipusukilo township threw himself into the Kafue river in an attempt to commit suicide. Read more: KITWE: Inmate commits suicide while in police custody Mweemba said without telling anyone,Mulenga went […]

title: Body of crocodile victim found floating on River Kafue
description:
Members of the community have after a prolonged search found the body of a woman in Kitwe’s Chipata township who was attacked by a crocodile on the banks of the Kafue River. It was reported that she went to fetch water in the Kafue river where she met her fate. Copperbelt police chief Peacewell Mweemba confirmed Sara Mumba’s body was found floating on the river after she was attacked on Sunday morning. Mweemba,in a statement said the deceased was found near Zambia township by some residents who conducted a search on the river using canoes. Also read: 6-year-old girl found […]

title: Futsal game gets boost, as Copperbelt Energy launches facilities
description:
The Copperbelt Energy Corporation (CEC) has launched  Futsal facilities at Kitwe’s the Ravens Country Club grounds. CEC managing director Owen Silavwe said the health and social wellbeing of  employees and the community was critical. Silavwe said on Saturday that the launch of the  facility  was another milestone in the Company’s investment in health wellness. “The futsal pitches are a welcome addition to an array of already existing health and fitness facilities provided by CEC; namely, the Ravens Gymnasium, Olympic-size swimming pool, golf course, tennis, and squash courts. “This narrative is obviously not complete without acknowledging CEC’s continued sponsorship of Power […]

title: KITWE: Inmate commits suicide while in police custody
description:
An inmate who was detained at Zamtan police post in Kitwe has taken his life by hanging himself on a burglar bar using a pair of socks. The suspect was taken to the police after he attempted to steal a goat from a farm within Zamtan compound, says Copperbelt Province Commanding Officer Peacewell Mweemba in a statement issued on Thursday. Police said Philison Kahalu 32 committed suicide in the early hours of Tuesday while in police cells. Mweemba explained that Kahalu was found dead by Frederick Mulenga, 27, a fellow inmate who went to the toilet. Read more: Police probe […]

title: Suspected armed robber shot dead in Lusaka, AK 47 rifle, ammunition recovered
description:
Police in Lusaka have shot dead one suspected dangerous criminal and recovered an AK 47 rifle with ammunition. The incident occured on January 27, 2023 around 18:00 hours along Kasangula Road, according to Godfrey Chilabi, Police Assistant Public Relations Officer. Chilabi explained that acting on a tip-off from an informer that criminals were about to stage a robbery, the Anti-robbery Squad was quickly dispatched to the area. “Facts of the matter are the Anti-robbery Squad spotted a Toyota Axio,along Kasangula road, matching the description given by the informant . “The said motor vehicle was parked by the roadside with three […]

title: Copperbelt Minister lauds Adventist church for developmental strides
description:
Copperbelt Province Minister Elisha Matambo has commended the Seventh Day Adventist (SDA) church for putting up various quality eduction and health facilities in the country. Matambo said this was in line with the government’s policy of free education, reintroduced by President Hakainde Hichilema, as well as the provision of quality health care. He paid tribute to the SDA church for their great contribution in supplimenting government efforts in the provision of social amenities especially in the health and education sectors. Speaking during a church service in an homily at Copperbelt University in Kitwe on Saturday, Matambo said it was a […]

title: ZESCO staff electrocuted on duty
description:
A ZESCO employee was electrocuted while on duty at Chibelo substation in Lusaka. The deceased who has been identified as Fackson Mbewe was pronounced dead upon arrival at the University Teaching Hospitals in Lusaka. This is according to the Police Assistant Public Relations Officer Godfrey Chilabi in a statement issued on Wednesday in Lusaka. title: Kitwe side, Power Dynamos signs Muwowo to beef up team
description:
Power Dynamos Football Club has completed the signing of winger Austin Muwowo as a free agent. “It’s done,” the football club said on its Facebook page on Tuesday. Also read:Power dynamos miss striker Musonda, stay hopeful of emerging champions (zambiamonitor.com) The 26-yearold former Orlando Pirates has joined Power after being released by Zesco United following an underwhelming stint on his return to Zambia. Power is now set to unveil both Muwowo and Zimbabwean striker Thomas Chideu, coming soon.

title: Landslide claims miner in Chingola, another survives
description:
Christian Silavwe 27, a miner at Rudra Copper Mine in Chingola, has been reported dead in a mine accident while a colleague survived. Silavwe and the surviving colleague Mulenga Nsama, 24, got trapped by the landslide. Police confirmed on Friday that Silavwe died after being trapped by the land slide he was working from while his colleague is nursing a fractured leg in hospital. Copperbelt Commanding officer Peacewell Mweemba said the incident happened on Thursday around 12:00 hours at the mining firm located off Kitwe – Chingola road. He said Sunketa Reddy 37 a production manager reported that the two […]

title: Power dynamos miss striker Musonda, stay hopeful of emerging champions
description:
Power Dynamos says it remains committed to achieve the set objectives for the 2022/2023 MTN/FAZ Super League season. This is despite having struggled with two consecutive stalemates in the first two games of the second round. Power Dynamos Chief Executive Officer, Gibson Chaloba said the Kitwe giants who were dominating the FAZ Super League table with 37 points, five points ahead of second placed Green Buffaloes had made good headway towards beefing up the squad after the departure of striker Kennedy Musonda. Musonda clinched a two-year deal with Tanzanian Premier League leaders Young Africans SC who are reported to have […]

title: How pastor raped 18-year-old girl —Prosecutor tells court
description:
An Arresting Officer has narrated in the Lusaka magistrate court how a Lusaka pastor who allegedly raped an 18-year-old girl gave her some unknown substances to make her unconscious. Teddy Chulu, 46, also informed the court that a medical report indicated that the victim was sexually assaulted. In this case, George Phiri, aged 30, a pastor of United End of Times Church in Kanyama compound pleaded not guilty to one count of rape. It is alleged that Phiri took the victim to a lodge and had sex with her as part of spiritual cleansing. It is also alleged that he […]

title: Police begin hunt for Kitwe garden boy who stole gun, 49 rounds of ammunition
description:
Police in Kitwe have launched a manhunt for a garden boy who is on the run after allegedly stealing a gun with 49 rounds of ammunition from a Chinese national he was working for. The police said the incident happened on Monday around 13:00 hours at Mable Flats in Riverside. Copperbelt police chief Peacewell Mweemba said He Zong reported that his firearm, a pistol Taurus white and black in colour with 49 rounds of ammunition, was stolen by an unknown person. But he strongly suspected his garden boy Kellys Chowa. The incident according to police happened when Zong was shifting […]

title: Crimes court charges Santorini Investments for alleged K18m tax evasion
description:
Santorini Investments Limited and its directors have been levelled with a 112 counts charge of tax offenses amounting to over K18 million. The accused persons are facing 112 counts of making false returns and statements contrary to section 43 and evasion of tax contrary to section 44 of the Value Added Tax (VAT), Chapter 331 of the Laws of Zambia. This is according to a statement issued in Zambia’s capital Lusaka on Wednesday by Zambia Revenue Authority (ZRA) corporate communications manager Oliver Nzala. title: Kabwe Warriors celebrate win over Nkana, vow to fight for top four
description:
Relegation threatened Kabwe Warriors coach Mumamba Numba says Warriors will fight to get more wins in the second round of the Super League to avoid dropping into the National Division one league. Numba said the win over Nkana last Sunday gave Warriors the needed confidence to fight for survival in the League where they seat on 16th position with 19 points collected from three wins, ten draws and five defeats. “We really needed the win over Nkana to improve on our confidence so that we can push in our next game. We need to get more wins as we go […]

title: Kitwe High Court records drop in murder cases, aggravated robbery
description:
Kitwe High Court judge Evaristo Pengele has revealed that murder cases declined to 32 in 2022 from 46 cases received the prior year. Judge Pengele said in comparison between the number of cases received in 2022 with those of 2021, there was a notable reduction in the murder cases, aggravated robbery and cases of causing death by dangerous driving. “While in 2021 we received 46 murder cases compared to 32 cases in 2022. Whereas in 2021 we received 11 aggravated robbery cases, in 2022 we received six. In 2021, we had 28 cases of causing death by dangerous driving, while in 2022 we […]

title: Power outages: Load shedding split into six-hourly schedule
description:
ZESCO has reduced the load shedding hours to six hours per phase each day from a continuous 12 hours as directed by President Hakainde Hichilema. This move is meant to give relief to customers while mitigating the impact the load shedding has on small businesses. Hichilema this week directed ZESCO to consider splitting the 12 hours of load shedding per area into a six-hourly schedule. The directive came after Hichilema and his entourage toured the Maamba Collieries, and Kariba ZESCO power plants to fully appreciate the extent of electricity generation capacities as a country. The tour began with the Maamba […]

title: Power Dynamos FC  unveils  new kit for 2023 season, vows to win league
description:
Power Dynamos Football Club (PDFC) has introduced a new Umbro kit for the 2022/2023 football season. Unveiling the kit in Kitwe on Friday PDFC Club president, Benny Simukoko said a properly dressed team was important in the club’s quest for a consistently top-notch performance on the pitch. Simukoko said the club was on course to achieve its objectives for the 2022/2023 season. This would include winning the local league and qualifying for continental football tournament the next season. He said the perennial support received from parent sponsor, Power Dynamos Football Club was motivating. Simukoko also welcomed Sarago Motors Limited as the new […]

title: Organised private sector want end to haphazard electricity rationing
description:
ZESCO must programme its electricity rationing time table in a way which will minimise negative impact on industries. Zambia’s power utility company started its load shedding countrywide on Tuesday due to low water levels in the Kariba dam. Private Sector Development (PSDA) chairperson Yusuf Dodia said ZESCO should engage all stakeholders such as farmers and industries to ensure that a proper time for load shedding was put in place, which does not cripple production. In an interview in Zambia’s capital Lusaka on Tuesday, Dodia indicated that as much as load shedding was supposed to be implemented, a well programmed exercise […]

title: 68 more drunk drivers nabbed during Yuletide by transport agency
description:
The Road Transport and Safety Agency (RTSA) has nabbed 68 motorists for drink driving during New Year’s Eve across Zambia. Livingstone and Kitwe have recorded the highest numbers. This was during a combined operation between the RTSA and the Zambia Police Service under the Drive Sober campaign which had been a success in reducing lawlessness on the road during the festive season. Read more:Transport agency nabs 43 motorists for drunk driving The combined team had been tasked to be mainly on the lookout for road infringements like driving under the influence of alcohol, dangerous driving and unlicensed drivers among others. […]

The post 68 more drunk drivers nabbed during Yuletide by transport agency first appeared on Zambia Monitor.

title: New fuel pump price will have minimal impact on small businesses —Group
description:
Alliance for Zambian Informal Economy Association (AZIEA) has said the recent adjustment in fuel pump price will have a minimal impact on the informal sector. On New Year’s Eve, the Energy Regulation Board (ERB) adjusted the price of fuel downwards to K24.49 from K25.89 representing a 5.41 percent drop. ERB board chairperson Reynolds Bowa said during a monthly fuel price review media briefing that low-sulphur diesel would be sold at K26.44 per litre from K27.38. Kerosene reduced by K0.47 to trade at K19.98 from K20.45 per litre in December as A-1 Jet fuel also reduced to K22.63 from K23.23 per […]

title: ZESCO to start scheduled load shedding programme Tuesday
description:
ZESCO is set to start its planned rotational Load Shedding exercise on Tuesday as water levels in Kariba Reservoir hit critically low levels. The company is set to commence its Load Shedding programme on Tuesday 3rd to 25th January 2023. ZESCO indicated that it had experienced a drastic reduction in available water for electricity generation at Kariba North Bank Power Station due to critically reduced water levels in the Kariba reservoir. Rangers overcame six-time champions Zesco in a quarter-final fixture 4-3 on lotteries after a 0-0 draw in 90 minutes. Although […]

title: K8 million CBU hall building starts
description: MWILA NTAMBI Kitwe COPPERBELT University (CBU) in Kitwe has launched construction of a 1,000-seater auditorium at K8 million. CBU vice-chancellor Imasiku Nyambe says building of the auditorium is a milestone as it will enhance infrastructure and the learning environment at the higher learning institution. He said once finished, the auditorium will host academic conferences and […]

title: Exercise aimed at recruiting 300,000 members in province
description: MELODY MUPETA Kitwe THE United Party for National Development (UPND) has launched a coordinated team which has been tasked to recruit 300, 000 new party members on the Copperbelt to help in mobilisation activities ahead of the 2026 general elections. The campaign team dubbed “2246” has been established to help garner more support for the […]

title: Green Mountain victims interred
description: MWILA NTAMBI Kitwe MINISTER of Mines and Minerals Development Paul Kabuswe says Government will put up strict guidelines for small-scale miners to ensure safe operations. Speaking at Chingola Road Cemetery in Kitwe yesterday during the burial of five small-scale miners who died on Saturday after a tailings dam collapsed on them at Green Mountain Mine, […]

Zesco United found out so in Absa Cup this season when they faced ‘Brave’ Nchanga Rangers. Rangers overcame six-time champions Zesco in a quarter-final fixture 4-3 on lotteries after a 0-0 draw in 90 minutes. Although […]

title: K8 million CBU hall building starts
description: MWILA NTAMBI Kitwe COPPERBELT University (CBU) in Kitwe has launched construction of a 1,000-seater auditorium at K8 million. CBU vice-chancellor Imasiku Nyambe says building of the auditorium is a milestone as it will enhance infrastructure and the learning environment at the higher learning institution. He said once finished, the auditorium will host academic conferences and […]

title: Exercise aimed at recruiting 300,000 members in province
description: MELODY MUPETA Kitwe THE United Party for National Development (UPND) has launched a coordinated team which has been tasked to recruit 300, 000 new party members on the Copperbelt to help in mobilisation activities ahead of the 2026 general elections. The campaign team dubbed “2246” has been established to help garner more support for the […]

title: Green Mountain victims interred
description: MWILA NTAMBI Kitwe MINISTER of Mines and Minerals Development Paul Kabuswe says Government will put up strict guidelines for small-scale miners to ensure safe operations. Speaking at Chingola Road Cemetery in Kitwe yesterday during the burial of five small-scale miners who died on Saturday after a tailings dam collapsed on them at Green Mountain Mine, […]
